archimate:Device.name: UPS for Critical Clinical Equipment (Computers on Wheels, Nursing Carts, Clinical
archimate:Device.documentation:
1. UPS for Servers (Core Application, Database, Analytics, Virtualization) (UPSS)
Purpose:
Protect high-performance, critical servers and data storage systems.
Specifications:
• Capacity: 3000–6000 VA (3–6 kVA) • Topology: Online (Double Conversion) UPS for highest protection • Runtime: Minimum 15–30 minutes at full load, with expandable external battery options • Input Voltage: 208/220V • Output Voltage: 208/220V (clean, regulated output) • Connectivity: Network management card for remote monitoring and alerts (SNMP compatible) • Features: Automatic Voltage Regulation (AVR), surge protection, hot-swappable battery • Form Factor: Rack-mounted (2U–4U)
2. UPS for Networking Infrastructure (Switches, Routers, Wi-Fi APs, Firewalls) (UPSN)
Purpose:
Keep critical network infrastructure running without interruption.
Specifications:
• Capacity: 1500–3000 VA (1.5–3 kVA) • Topology: Line-interactive UPS with AVR (Automatic Voltage Regulation) • Runtime: Minimum 30 minutes • Input Voltage: 120V (50/hz)/220V • Output Voltage: 120V/220V (clean output) • Connectivity: Network management ( SNMP card for monitoring and management) • Features: Surge suppression, noise filtering, hot-swappable batteries • Form Factor: Rack-mounted (1U–2U)
3. UPS for Critical Clinical Equipment (Computers on Wheels, Nursing Carts, Clinical Monitors) (UPSC)
Purpose:
Ensure critical mobile clinical devices have stable power, avoiding disruptions to patient care.
Specifications:
• Capacity: 500–1000 VA (0.5–1 kVA) per charging/storage station or nursing station • Topology: Line-interactive or standby • Runtime: Minimum 20–30 minutes • Input Voltage: 120V/50Hz • Output Voltage: 120V (regulated output) • Connectivity: basic monitoring via USB or Ethernet • Features: Compact, quiet operation, battery failure alerts • Form Factor: Compact desktop or wall-mountable
